name: mcmd

procedures: T1005::[MCMD] has the ability to upload files from an infected device.
T1027::[MCMD] can Base64 encode output strings prior to sending to C2.
T1036.005::[MCMD] has been named Readme.txt to appear legitimate.
T1053.005::[MCMD] can use scheduled tasks for persistence.
T1059.003::[MCMD] can launch a console process (cmd.exe) with redirected standard input and output.
T1070.009::[MCMD] has the ability to remove set Registry Keys, including those used for persistence.
T1071.001::[MCMD] can use HTTPS in communication with C2 web servers.
T1105::[MCMD] can upload additional files to a compromised host.
T1547.001::[MCMD] can use Registry Run Keys for persistence.
T1564.003::[MCMD] can modify processes to prevent them from being visible on the desktop.

description: [MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) is a remote access tool that provides remote command shell capability used by [Dragonfly 2.0](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0074).(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
